p: A polar fraction of an ethanolic leaf extract of E. montanum displayed a low antimicrobial activity with a MIC > 750 μg/ml against bacteria ( B. cereus ATCC 14579, Enterobacter cloacae ATCC 13047, E. coli ATCC 8739, K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883, Mycobacterium fortuitum ATCC 6841, P. vulgaris ATCC 13315, P. aeruginosa ATCC 15442, Salmonella typhimurium ATCC 13311, S. aureus ATCC 6538, Streptococcus pyogenes ATCC 12344) and fungi ( C. albicans ATCC 10231, isolates of Trichophyton rubrum RV 58125, Epidermophyton floccosum RV 71625 and Microsporum canis RV 66973) ( Cos et al., 2002b).
